meanings.definition: To smile in a smug or self-satisfied way.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but smerk when she won the game.
meanings.sent2: He always smerks when he thinks he's right.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to smerk after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: His smerk revealed his true feelings about the situation.
meanings.sent5: The villain's smerk hinted at his evil intentions.

meanings.definition: A smirk expression on one's face.
meanings.sent1: Her smerk showed she was up to something mischievous.
meanings.sent2: He wore a smerk that made others wonder what he was planning.
meanings.sent3: The painting of the Mona Lisa's smerk is famous worldwide.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's smerk added to the humor of his jokes.
meanings.sent5: The child's smerk brightened up the room.
